（使）（钟等）鸣响，（雷等）发出隆隆声

sentence.Network_en: I heard a peal of merry laughter.
sentence.Network_cn: 我听到一阵响亮的欢笑声。

sentence.Network_en: A peal of church bells rang out in the distance.
sentence.Network_cn: 远处响起了一阵教堂的钟声。

sentence.Network_en: The bells of the cathedral rang out their loud peal.
sentence.Network_cn: 大教堂响起了响亮的钟声.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...一般情况。而所谓的前加特例，就是把某些形似前缀的字母组合看做是该前缀的特例予以强化记忆，扩展词汇量。peal 泥炭repeal 重复

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: shortening of appeal

entry.def: When bells peal, they ring one after another, making a musical sound.

example.ex: Church bells pealed at the stroke of midnight.

entry.tran: 持久响亮的声音；轰轰的响声
entry.def: A peal of laughter or thunder consists of a long, loud series of sounds.

example.ex: I heard a peal of merry laughter.
example.tran: 我听到一阵响亮的欢笑声。

means.word_mean: 1. a deep prolonged sound (as of thunder or large bells)

sentences.en: A sudden peal of thunder leaves no time to cover the ears.
She let out a peal of laughter.
The bells of the cathedral rang out their loud peal.
sentences.cn: 大教堂响起了响亮的钟声。
